com.anotherservice.rest

Class Handler

  • Object
    • Handler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Action, Index, Index.UTF8Handler

    public abstract class Handler
extends Object
    This is the abstract handler class for the REST service. Do not extend this class as only the Index and Action subclasses will be taken into account by the Router. This class also provides convenient methods for handling the hyerarchy of the REST service.
    Author:
    Simon Uyttendaele
    See Also:
    Index, Action

        toString in class Object
        Returns:

      • addMapping

        public void addMapping(String mapping)
        Adds a mapping for this handler. Mappings are always lowercase for case insensitivity in the latter URL request.
        Parameters:
        mapping - The mapping to add for this handler
        See Also:
        Router.route()
        Note:
        null or empty mapping is silently ignored

      • addMapping

        public void addMapping(Collection<String> mappings)
        Adds all mappings to this handler.
        Parameters:
        mappings - The mappings to add for this handler
        Note:
        null or empty mappings are silently ignored

      • addMapping

        Adds all mappings to this handler.
        Parameters:
        mappings - The mappings to add for this handler
        Note:
        null or empty mappings are silently ignored

      • hasMapping

        public boolean hasMapping(String mapping)
        Checks whether or not this handler has the specified mapping
        Parameters:
        mapping - The mapping to check
        Returns:
        true if the handler matches this mapping, false otherwise

      • hasMapping

        public boolean hasMapping(Collection<String> mappings)
        Checks whether or not this handler has any of the specified mappings
        Parameters:
        mappings - The list mapping to check
        Returns:
        true if the handler matches any of the mappings, false if none matches

      • addGrant

        public void addGrant(String grant)
        Adds a required access grant for this handler. Grants are always lowercase.
        Parameters:
        grant - The grant to add to this handler
        See Also:
        Security, ISecurity
        Note:
        • A Security provider must be defined in order to use grants
        • null or empty grant is silently ignored

      • addGrant

        public void addGrant(Collection<String> grants)
        Adds all grants to this handler
        Parameters:
        grants - The grants to add to this handler
        Note:
        null or empty grants are silently ignored

      • addGrant

        public void addGrant(String[] grants)
        Adds all grants to this handler
        Parameters:
        grants - The grants to add to this handler
        Note:
        null or empty grants are silently ignored

      • getGrants

        public Collection<String> getGrants()
        Returns the list of required grants of this handler
        Returns:
        The list of grants of this handler

      • wrapExecute

        public final Object wrapExecute()
                         throws Exception
        Changes the ClassLoader context to the one registered using the register() method, then calls the intercal checkAuth() method, then calls the internal execute() method.
        Returns:
        The result of the execute method
        Throws:
        Exception
        See Also:
        execute(), checkAuth()

      • checkAuth

        public void checkAuth()
               throws Exception
        Perform security checks. Default behavior is to call ISecurity.hasGrants(Collection) with this instance's getGrants().
        Throws:
        Exception - if security checks do not pass.
        See Also:
        Security
        Note:
        Overriding this method is touchy but may be required in very specific situations. In this case, know what you do as security is not something to play with !

      • execute

        protected abstract Object execute()
                           throws Exception
        Executes this handler. Must be implemented by subclasses.
        Returns:
        The result of the handler execution
        Throws:
        Exception
        Note:
        The execute method will be called on the single registered instance of this handler. Thus, the execution should be repeatable, thread safe and memory proof.

      • getRoot

        public static Index getRoot()
        Returns the root handler.
        Returns:
        The root Index handler
        See Also:
        Index

      • addHandler

        public static void addHandler(String path,
              Handler handler)
        Hooks the specified handler at the end (aka: after) in the chain of handlers defined by the path.
        Parameters:
        path - The absolute path leading to the parent handler to hook to. The path is composed of chained handler mappings separated by forward slashes ("/")
        handler - The handler to append

      • removeHandler

        public static void removeHandler(String path)
        Removes the handler represented by the last part of the chain defined by path. This means that the last part of the path should be one of the handler's mappings
        Parameters:
        path - The absolute path leading to the handler to be removed

      • hasHandler

        public static boolean hasHandler(String path)
        Checks whether or not the specified path leads to a handler.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to check
        Returns:
        true if the complete path leads to a valid handler. false otherwise

      • getHandler

        public static Handler getHandler(String path)
        Returns the handler targetted by the specified path.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the handler
        Returns:
        The handler matching that path or null if no handler matches

      • getNearest

        public static Handler getNearest(String path)
        Returns the last handler found for the specified path. If the path targets an existing handler, this method has the same effect as getHandler(). If a handler is not found at the target path, the parent handler is returned. At worst, the root handler is returned.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the potential handler
        Returns:
        The nearest handler in the path chain

      • getParent

        public static Index getParent(Handler h)
        Returns the parent handler (index) of the specified handler.
        Parameters:
        h - The target handler
        Returns:
        The parent of the target handler or null if no parent is found

      • parent

        public final Index parent()
        Returns the current parent handler

      • getPath

        public static String getPath(Handler handler)
        Returns the main path leading to the specified handler.
        Parameters:
        handler - The target handler
        Returns:
        The absolute path to the target handler or null if the handler is not part of the chain or cannot be found
        Note:
        The main path is the chain of all getMapping() leading to that handler
